alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Fulton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Franklin and Fulton. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chambersburg, Greencastle, Guilford, St. Thomas, Fayetteville, Mercersburg, Scotland, Marion, Fort Loudon, Claylick, Williamson, Upton and Whitetail Ski Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
